key_points: A Kenosha County jury viewed videos showing Kyle Rittenhouse shooting three men during protests.
This was the first time the jury saw these videos pieced together, depicting the events of August 2020.
Kyle Rittenhouse, 17 at the time, crossed state lines and was armed with an AR-15-style rifle during the Kenosha protests.
Rittenhouse has pleaded not guilty, claiming self-defense in the shootings of Joseph Rosenbaum, Anthony Huber, and Gaige Grosskreutz.
Videos include Rittenhouse's pre-shooting interviews and scenes from the night, including the moment he shot the three men.
Testimony included Rittenhouse's actions before the shootings and observations from social media influencer Koerri Washington.
Rosenbaum, who chased Rittenhouse, threw a plastic bag at him before being shot; he was not armed.
Jurors watched efforts to aid the injured Rosenbaum and Grosskreutz, the latter instructing on how to apply a tourniquet.
Rittenhouse approached police with raised arms after shooting Grosskreutz but was ignored.
The defense stressed the threat of disarmament, with detective Martin Howard testifying it's reasonable to fear one's gun could be used against them.
